info.name: Book of the Fallen - Custom Spells
info.description: Contains Custom Spells created specifically for the campaign "Book of the Fallen".

description.p: In the beginning, there was only darkness. It will return.

Choose a location within range that is within 5 feet of a creature or in dim light or darkness. You teleport to this location. As a bonus action before or after teleporting, you can make a single melee attack against a target within your reach.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the range increases by 5 feet and the amount of attacks increases by 1 for each extra level.
You have the ability to burn Steel.This spell is only available to Mistborn.

Coinshots can "Push" on nearby metals. This can allow them to make metallic objects that weigh less than they do to fly through the air away from them (using coins, for instance, as weapons). For metallic objects which weigh more than they do, this can cause them to be pushed away from the object. It was generally assumed that a Coinshot could not Push on metals that pierce or are otherwise contained in the body of another (e.g., ingested metals).
Pushing. You can push the equivalent to your weight practically 40 feet.

Coinshot. Replace one or more Attacks with coinshot, where you can hurl a number of coins, or other similarly shaped metal, equal to your intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) towards an enemy at a distance of up to 60 feet causing 1d12 piercing damage for each coin.

Metallic Hail. As an Action direct a hail of metallic shards (usually coins) at a point of at least 20 feet away from you, to a max of 60 feet. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point, OR in the path of the shards/coins, must make a Dexterity saving throw equal to your Character Level + Proficiency Bonus. A target takes 4d12 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The coins/shards land at that sphere and can be used in subsequent turns by Allomancers.

Metal Haze. As a Bonus Action push metallic dust into the eyes of a creature withing 10 feet. The creature must succeed on a constitution saving throw equal to your Character Level + Proficiency Bonus or be blinded. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of their round.
You have the ability to burn Iron.This spell is only available to Mistborn.

Lurchers have the ability to burn Iron, which allows them to Pull on nearby metals. The Lurchers abilities mirror that of Coinshots with the caveat that the metal must originate in a location away from them, in order to pull it. Throwing metal shards to a distance of 10 feet from them is a free action, and to a distance between 10 and 60 feet requires a bonus action. (can be done once per turn).
Pulling. You can pull the equivalent to your weight practically 40 feet.

Coinshot. Replace one or more Attacks with coinshot, where you can Pull a number of coins, or other similarly shaped metal, equal to your intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) towards an enemy at a distance of up to 60 feet causing 1d12 piercing damage for each coin.

Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point, OR in the path of the shards/coins, must make a Dexterity saving throw equal to your Character Level + Proficiency Bonus. A target takes 4d12 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The coins/shards land at that sphere and can be used in subsequent turns by Allomancers.

Metal Haze. As a Bonus Action push metallic dust into the eyes of a creature withing 10 feet. The creature must succeed on a constitution saving throw equal to your Character Level + Proficiency Bonus or be blinded. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of their round.
You have the ability to burn Iron and Steel at the same time.This spell is only available to Mistborn.
Kestrels have the ability to burn Iron and Steel, which allows them to Pull and Push on nearby metals.

Kestrel in Flight. As a bonus action use metal (provided there is) around your environment to hover into the air, you replace your move action to move 40 feet to any direction. You must be a minimum of 120 feet from 2 metal objects to achieve this. (this put usual achievable hover height to about 60 feet) You require both metals burning to stabilize your hovering. Falling unconscious or becoming unable to burn iron and steel at the same time stops this effect. You can safely land if you can reduce your falling rate with only one metal burning.

ul.li: Disarm: As a Bonus Action, by both tugging and pushing on a metal item in the hands of a creature you can attempt to dislodge it from their grasp. The creature must must make a Strength saving throw equal to your Character Level + Proficiency Bonus or the item flies 10 feet either towards, or away from you.

Knockdown: As a Bonus Action, by both tugging and pushing on metal armor of a humanoid your size you can attempt to disrupt their balance and send them prone. The creature must must make a Strength saving throw equal to your Character Level + Proficiency Bonus or they fall prone.

You have the ability to burn Pewter.This spell is only available to Mistborn.

Pewterarms, or Thugs, have the ability to burn Pewter, which allows them to greatly enhance their physical capabilities. While burning pewter, a Thug can fight or perform physical labor longer than any normal person, and is also many times stronger than his or her normal self. This enhanced strength also allows a Thug to shrug off wounds that would kill or incapacitate a normal person. Pewter-burning also provides a Thug with an increased sense of balance and vastly increased speed and dexterity.

Thug. Dexterity and strength increase temporarily by 4. Similarly your movement speed increases by 20 feet and carrying capacity doubles. After completing the burn the user must succeed a DC 15 or suffer a level of exhaustion. For every extra pewter bead burned withing the next 10 minutes the DC increases by 5 and the level of exhaustion by 1.

Pewter drag. (lasts 20 min per bead, requires concentration)Increase only movement speed by 40 feet and triple your carrying capacity for a significantly longer period. After completing the burn the user must succeed a DC 15 or suffer a level of exhaustion. For every extra pewter bead burned withing the next 10 minutes the DC increases by 5 and the level of exhaustion by 1.

description.p:
Pillars of lava erupt from the chosen points, shattering the earth and reaching a height of 20 feet. Each pillar of flame occupies a 5ft square and deals 10d6 points of Fire damage on a failed dexterity save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail the save are knocked prone.
The spell creates a number of pillars equal to 2x Proficiency bonus.
The flame ignites flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.
At Higher Levels:When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 4th.

setters.set: a small piece of petrified lava
